references.paper_title: Convolutional neural networks on graphs with fast localized spectral filtering
references.reason: This paper introduces a foundational spectral graph convolutional neural network (GNN) architecture which is a primary building block for many subsequent GNN designs, making it highly influential to the field.

references.paper_title: Semi-supervised classification with graph convolutional networks
references.reason: This highly-cited paper provides a simpler and more efficient spectral GNN architecture than previous work, leading to wider adoption of GNNs in machine learning.

references.paper_title: Geometric deep learning: Going beyond Euclidean data
references.reason: This paper lays out the foundational principles of geometric deep learning (GDL), which provides a theoretical framework for applying deep learning to non-Euclidean data such as graphs, making it highly influential to the field.

references.paper_title: Cayleynets: Graph convolutional neural networks with complex rational spectral filters
references.reason: This paper proposes a novel spectral GNN architecture based on Cayley polynomials, which improves upon previous spectral GNN architectures in terms of efficiency and expressiveness.

references.paper_title: Understanding and extending subgraph GNN by rethinking their symmetries
references.reason: This paper delves into the theoretical underpinnings of subgraph GNNs and introduces improvements to these models, demonstrating a deeper understanding of graph symmetries and their impact on model performance.
